org.turbogwt.net.http.client

Interface Request

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RequestDispatcher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RequestImpl

    public interface Request
    This type provides fluent style request building.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Request accept(AcceptHeader acceptHeader)
      Set the Accept header of the request.
      Request accept(String contentType)
      Set the content type accepted for the response.
      Request contentType(String contentType)
      Set the content type of this request.
      Request header(Header header)
      Sets a request header.
      Request header(String header, String value)
      Sets a request header with the given name and value.
      Request password(String password)
      Sets the password to use in the request URL.
      Request payload(Object object)
      Input a object to be sent in the HTTP Request payload.
      Request timeout(int timeoutMillis)
      Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for a request to complete.
      Request user(String user)
      Sets the user name that will be used in the request URL.

    • Method Detail

      • contentType

        Request contentType(String contentType)
        Set the content type of this request.
        Parameters:
        contentType - The content type of this request
        Returns:
        the updated Request

      • accept

        Request accept(String contentType)
        Set the content type accepted for the response.
        Parameters:
        contentType - The content type accepted for the response
        Returns:
        the updated Request

      • accept

        Request accept(AcceptHeader acceptHeader)
        Set the Accept header of the request.
        Parameters:
        acceptHeader - The accept header of the request.
        Returns:
        the updated Request

      • header

        Request header(String header,
             String value)
        Sets a request header with the given name and value. If a header with the specified name has already been set then the new value overwrites the current value.
        Parameters:
        header - the name of the header
        value - the value of the header
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if header or value are null
        IllegalArgumentException - if header or value are the empty string

      • header

        Request header(Header header)
        Sets a request header. If a header with the specified name has already been set then the new value overwrites the current value.
        Parameters:
        header - the header instance

      • user

        Request user(String user)
        Sets the user name that will be used in the request URL.
        Parameters:
        user - user name to use
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the user is empty
        NullPointerException - if the user is null

      • password

        Request password(String password)
        Sets the password to use in the request URL. This is ignored if there is no user specified.
        Parameters:
        password - password to use in the request URL
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the password is empty
        NullPointerException - if the password is null

      • timeout

        Request timeout(int timeoutMillis)
        Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for a request to complete. Should the request timeout, the RequestCallback.onError(com.google.gwt.http.client.Request, Throwable) method will be called on the callback instance given to the RequestBuilder.sendRequest(String, com.google.gwt.http.client.RequestCallback) method. The callback method will receive an instance of the RequestTimeoutException class as its Throwable argument.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - number of milliseconds to wait before canceling the request, a value of zero disables timeouts
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout value is negative

      • payload

        Request payload(Object object)
        Input a object to be sent in the HTTP Request payload.

        This object will be serialized considering its class and the current content-type.
        If no serializer was found matching these two factors, the a exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        object - the payload of the request
        Returns:
        the updated Request
